result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court grants the defendant 83 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-No Violent Contact with the victim. 
-Def is to take all medications as prescribed by a doctor.
-Mental Health Assessment and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: -Sentence is to commence within 60 days, on or before June 24, 2022 at 11:00 AM unless defendant's agent directs him to serve it sooner.  Court does not grants huber, out-of-county service or out-of-county travel.

1:19 PM PM Defendant NATHANIEL J DICOSIMO in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the hearing scheduled for today - Motion to Modify Sentence and goes over the number of filings that have been filed since that time by the defendant. Court makes statement to the defendant. Court questions DA Laspisa. Statement by DA Laspisa, believes the notice to pursue postconviction relief or predisposition relief. is outside the timeframe. Further statement by DA Laspisa, was last in court in July to modify sentence and was denied. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant - requests the felonies be amended to misdemeanors and states reasons. Statement by the Court - denies the defendant's motions.

3:50 PM Defendant NATHANIEL J DICOSIMO in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes we heard this case earlier today and def would like to accept the offer. Def concurs.  DA Laspisa recites offer - plea to count 1 with repeater and 3 with repeater and will dismiss and read in count 2 and 4. Count 1 , probation with conditional jail time with conditions, court costs, DNA, and conditions. Count 3, probation. Defendant would like to accept the offer. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to count 1 with repeaters, NO CONTEST to count 3 as repeater. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and 3 and will dismiss and read-in count 2 and 4. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by the victim. Sentencing statement by the defendant. 

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 & Count 3

-SWD and places def on probation for 3 years.  

CONDITIONS:

-(count 1) 4 months conditional jail time. Sentence is to commence within 60 days, on or before June 24, 2022 at 11:00 AM unless defendant's agent directs him to serve it sooner. Court does not grant huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.  
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-No Violent Contact with the victim. 
-Def is to take all medications as prescribed by a doctor.
-AODA - follow-up.
-Mental Health Assessment and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants defendant 83 days jail credit that will be applied if the def is revoked.
Court instructs def to check with the probation office by the end of the business day tomorrow.

Court terminates bond.


Court adjourned at 4:22 PM

2:21 PM Defendant NATHANIEL J DICOSIMO in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes this is his first time hearing this case and goes over the case history.  Def submitted a request for court appointed counsel and request for a bond hearing. Court received a letter from the public defenders office. Def does qualify for a public defender but they have been unable to find an attorney for the defendant at this time. DA Laspisa notes the victim is present in court. DA Laspisa states the State is looking at filing a new case for the def violating the no contact order. Court states he is open to having a court appointed attorney but states once there is a speedy trial demand it is sometimes more difficult to obtain an attorney. Court notes def has a right to a court appointed attorney and a right to a speedy trial but he may be less likely to obtain an attorney with the speedy trial demand. Statement by the defendant - would rather have the speedy trial than wait for an attorney. Court states they will appoint an attorney on this case and informs the def he will have to make monthly payments for the attorney during the duration of the case. Court requests the clerk to start the process for a court appointed attorney for the defendant.

Defendant makes statement regarding bond modification. Victim is present and wishes to address the Court. DA Laspisa confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Statement by the victim. DA Laspisa objects to bond modification and goes over the defendant's criminal history. DA Laspisa has concerns the the no contact order has already been violated. Statement by the Court. Court believes bond is appropriate as set and denies motion to modify bond. 

Court sets Jury Trial for July 6, 2022 8:15 AM. 

DA Laspisa notes an offer was given to the def's previous attorney. DA Laspisa recites offer - plea to count 1 and 3 and will dismiss and read in count 2 and 4. Count 1 , probation with conditional jail time with conditions, court costs, DNA, and conditions. Count 3, probation. Defendant states he would like to look over that offer. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Court informs the defendant he will give him time to look over the offer presented by the DA. Court will set a plea/sentencing date. Def has no objection to the Court appearing by zoom. Court notes he will see if we can set the plea/sentencing for later this afternoon. DA Laspisa states she'll make herself available.

Court adjourned at 3:00 PM.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - no counsel appointed at this time
Inmate Request to the Court
Atty Michael Kapelis

9:05 AM Defendant NATHANIEL J DICOSIMO appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for NATHANIEL J DICOSIMO, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Atty Kapelis advises that the defendant is still requesting his preliminary hearing. DA Laspisa has one Witness.

Tyler McDowell sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed by the Berlin Police Department as a Patrol Officer. Was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Kapelis. Atty kapelis requests a date for the Arraignment. Court will set for Arraignment on March 23, 2022 at 10:45 AM.

DA Laspisa has a complaint drafted for this case and needs to swear it. The victim is present via zoom. Statement by the victim. DA makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court orders bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
